wikipedia_page.main: Delphine Mary Vera Parrott FRSE (2 May 1928 – 17 January 2016) was a British endocrinologist, immunologist, and academic. She did research at the National Institute for Medical Research in the 1950s and the Imperial Cancer Research Fund in the 1960s.In 1967, she moved to the University of Glasgow and became its first female professor in 1973. She became the Gardiner Professor of Immunology there in 1980 and retired in 1990.She was an honorary member of the British Society for Immunology.

response: In 1973, Delphine Parrott became its first female professor, as Gardiner Professor of Immunology.
* Delphine Parrott, British endocrinologist and immunologist

link_mentions.page: List of University of Glasgow people
response: * Delphine Parrott, endocrinologist and immunologist, Gardiner Professor of Immunology 1980-1990
In 2018 she received the Delphine Parrott award for inspiring female scientists by Megan MacLeod during the West of Scotland Immunology Group showcase at the University of Glasgow
She won a Gulbenkian Foundation scholarship. and from 1964 to 1966 de Sousa worked with Delphine Parrott studying mice who had their thymus removed.
